website_summaries.verdict: A good entry-level bike with an impressive number of workout options for the price.
pros: Built for convenience, with statistics tracking that transfers using USB
Pedal while relaxing using media shelf for entertainment
Quiet and takes up relatively little space
cons: Some reports of a clicking noise when you pedal
The seat may be hard for some, so consider buying a pad

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bike for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and decided this bike has the best bang for the buck. I was right. For the money, I love this bike. The only thing I didn't realize from the photos is that the electronics are not back lit. Not a big deal because there's light in the room I have it placed in. But the 170 (the backlit model) is twice the money. I think I'm happy with what I got. Thank God I was able to turn off that annoying beep. I think the bike looks very clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Loud clunking noise when pedaling
customer_reviews.text: Bike is nice but after three uses the pedals started making a loud clunking noise. This occurs in an area that was already assembled by manufacturer. It appears this is a common problem. Called tech support and they immediately indicated that they did not have a fix and refunded half my money. Bike is still working if you want to put up with the noise!
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Huber

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike, Sadly Defective
customer_reviews.text: Bought with installation. Pleased initially with size, set up and function, but after three weeks of light use, a loud, thumping vibration came from the behind the casing of the right pedal. Amazon is working with me to replace and somehow pick up without our having to dismantle the whole thing. Hope this one is an anomaly and the replacement works.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t even used it and it’s broken
customer_reviews.text: We put this bike together and as soon as I started using it, it was making a loud knocking noise. After peddling with the cover off I could see that with every down stroke on the left pedal the fly wheel was leaning to the left. Call the 800-number to find out that they are only open weekdays business hours. Somewhat hard to call about the bike when I’m at work and the bikes at home. For this price I expect it to work for a couple years. If I get any satisfaction from the 800 number I will update this review, otherwise I’m returning this piece of crap
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B. Shiels

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bike, reward yourself with a beer!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this bike has been great. Assembly was fairly simple and only requires one person. The computer is convenient and easy to use. It also comes with a handy little beer holder to keep you cool during your morning workout. It’s 5 o’clock somewhere, amiright??? But seriously, this is a pretty great bike for the price! Just use caution for your tush. I strongly advise buying a seat cushion because after one use my poor little bum felt bruised.
customer_reviews.author: R&A McCallion

customer_reviews.title: Great therapy for my Total Knee Replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as part of my rehab for total knee replacement. It's a good machine with prebuilt as well as customer programs. 20 levels of resistance. I have very long legs and I can get them straight if I need to for full extension. Suitable for much smaller people also. Easy to put together (just me). Some people complained the seat is uncomfortable. For the first 2 rides it was but your butt gets used to it. I can spend 30 mins on it without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: NIce bike
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice bike. Like in the other reviews the seat is hard so I order a Schwinn gel seat. The gel seat is comfortable. I had no problems putting on the peddles. The bike is able to accommodate both me and my wife. I am 6' 5" and my wife is 5' 3". It took me and my wife 1 and a half hours to put this bike together which is a good time for us. I am sure younger people could put it together in half an hour to one hour.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Ok bike
customer_reviews.text: 57 days 600 miles later I’ve had to replace fly wheel. My digital panels developing on and off issues. Two major components of exercise bike is this an issue? Yes and no, warranty repairs for fly wheel went smoothly. Second issue haven’t dealt with yet. Bike does ride smoothly. Seats are never comfortable. Only wish the digital panel was back lit. Would I recommend exercise bike, big Question? If you ride bike a lot during its warranty period and can catch potential problems I would suggest buying bike. Occasional user buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's features are probably unmatched. It assembled easy, and the interface is pretty intuitive. I'm not the strongest or in the best shape, but there's plenty of resistance available to make the quads burn, heart beat, and lungs struggle. The program selection may be a bit limited, but it's ok. Cons, I'm 6'1" the seat goes high enough but the bars are low, and close to you, it's not super comfortable. The built in speakers aren't great, the fan doesn't really do much, and I'm pretty sure the app is not supported.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Great Exercise Bike for home.
customer_reviews.text: Since the gym is closed due to COV-19 this bike has exceeded my expectations. It’s easy to put together. Doesn’t take up too much space. It’s quiet when working out. I really like all the cool features. The seat is wide and big booty friendly. Holds 300lbs. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: The Yoruba Family

customer_reviews.title: Makes a clunky noise when pedaling, cheap flimsy bike. Terrible packaging impossible to return.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a battered, poorly packaged box. Once you take it out, all the styrofoam basically disintegrates, which means you practically can't return it. OK, went ahead and put it together anyways, as I couldn't see how I could return it without proper packaging. Assembly went fine, and it started up with no initial issue. On the first use, it started making this "clunk" noise when you pedaled (what other reviewers have alluded to) at random times. It's annoying even when you have headphones on, as you can feel it through your body. Don't buy it. Pay a bit more and buy something else, or buy from a shop with good service.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Almost ideal
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a bit more difficult than I hoped. There remains a clicking noise (which is extremely irritating and I feel makes the intensity harder than it should be) when in use but to take it apart again would be crazy...intensity levels are a bit lacking. I purchased this bike for my parents to get them a bit more active but fear that it might be too much for them...there doesn’t seem to be a low resistance for them.
customer_reviews.author: Maria R.

customer_reviews.title: Crank Noise
customer_reviews.text: This is a follow up review about the noise issue. Each turn of the crank emitted a loud "thunk" sound. I called the Nautilus number to report the issue as advised with the instructions. The tech was able to hear the sound with my phone, and he analyzed the problem, had parts shipped and installed by a technician. The repair tech found the right pedal set of crank ball bearing were installed backwards! After installing the new ones correctly, the sound was gone! So, it was a manufacturer's assembly issue. Perhaps this may be the reason others have heard the same sound. I called within a week of assembling the bike. Glad I did as Nautilus was very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: russellb

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and smooth.  Comfortable seat
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and set it up. Used it for only 10 minutes so far. Assembly was straight forward. The electrical connectors took more pressure to lock than I would have preferred. It's very quiet and smooth. The seat is comfortable. The setup is not that obvious. I'm not sure how to enter my age etc. I'll mostly use manual mode. So this isnt so important.
customer_reviews.author: buddy

customer_reviews.title: Bent wires
customer_reviews.text: THE PROBLEM: The wiring for the data cable connection was not right. It arrived bent. See photo. Luckily I was able to realign it with a pair of tweezers. Hopefully that doesn't void the warranty! THE PLUS SIDE: Overall it is a great looking bike that doesn't take up a lot of space. The assembly was simple and I look forward to using it as I (and every other person in the world) am social distancing at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lind

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for price
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for and at a decent price. Assembly: No written instructions, just illustrations. Not bad, took under an hour. Stability: very stable, no wobbling. Comfortable, quiet, smooth. No batteries required but you’ll need an outlet to utilize the screen functions/programs. The only negative is the screen isn’t backlit. Didn’t think it would matter but the bike is set up in a darkish corner, so it’d definitely be nice. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Fay

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike ... But
customer_reviews.text: Just like a few other customers, my bike had the annoying CLICK in the left pedal. Not something you could ride with, as it is very annoying. Luckily, mine happened within the first 2 miles of riding it. I called Amazon and a service company is coming to get it. Yes, I returned it. It is a beautiful bike otherwise and was very smooth. But that CLICK will drive you insane and it also is a slight bump to your foot. Not right for a brand new unit. Big thing I want to say here is this: AMAZON ROCKS! ... No questions, no hassle return of the item. That's why I do choose Amazon to shop.
customer_reviews.author: Old Athlete

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike but not for the shorter group.
customer_reviews.text: don't remember how many years ago I bought this, but it's great. I had no trouble putting it together. I ride it everyday. It feels sturdy and the controls are easy to use. It's easy to move (and I'm not a strong person) to the side when I'm done. The only issue I have is that the specs say it's for people 4' 6" and higher; I'm 5' 1" and I have the seat as low as it can go, but it's just not 100% comfortable. As I said, I ride it everyday so it's not that far off, but if I was 4' 6", no way I'd be able to ride comfortably. Just a head's up.
customer_reviews.author: Cerys

customer_reviews.title: Received a used one
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived nearly open, held together by 1" of tape. Upon opening, I discovered the bike had wear and tear, and extra screws from the last assembly attempt were still affixed in various bike parts. I did NOT order a used one, I don't appreciate being misled like this, and I am not willing to own something that was returned by someone else for most likely a good reason.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Simple build, completed setup in under and hour and a half
customer_reviews.text: Was generally pretty simple to setup until we got to the seat. The seat was falling apart inside and constantly squeaks when riding. There are also exposed cords on the handle bar where a piece of plastic is the only thing to hide them but not cover them. I would give this 5 stars if the seat didnt constantly squeak. Edit: It has been close to two months for them to get back to me on a defective part. I am still unable to reach customer service by calls or emails. Amazon also has 0 responses from them in the last few weeks. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Had a Schwinn bike growin' up so I thought the quality should be the same.... not! Exercise bike stuck on one program and even if I unplug it for days, it still goes back to the same program. Wife cannot use it because it's an advanced level. Tried calling their customer care line and waited on phone for 55 minutes and got disconnected! It said wait time is 119 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Stuntman Dan

customer_reviews.title: Basic machine does the job.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, for the price this machine does the basics. I can get good and sweaty on this machine. I haven't figured out the programs, so I use the manual setting and change it up to simulate hills. I bought a padded seat to help out with the comfort. I can't really stand in the saddle very well. The shelves for cell phones and such could be more accommodating. If you're interested in an entry level machine this is fine. The people who came and installed it were great!
customer_reviews.author: J. G. Bispo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I'm old and fat and need to move if I wanna live. It's super quite, very sturdy and the electronics are good. As long as it lasts a long time I'll be very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Pat and Laura

customer_reviews.title: ... making a clicking noise unless I set the resistance pretty high, not annoying enough to go through a ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps making a clicking noise unless I set the resistance pretty high, not annoying enough to go through a return process. Wouldn't purchase again though.
customer_reviews.author: Jab

customer_reviews.title: BEST UPRIGHT imho
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, my wife and I are life long gym rats and we needed a "home solution" for the pandemic. We researched and agreed that Schwinn (owned by Nautilus to our amazement) offered the best solution for our price point. The 130 is not too big (like a 170) and not too small (like an A10); it sits right in the sweet spot. All parts arrived, instructions were easy to follow and we had it up in less than 2 hours. Everything works fine and its QUIET! W love the magnetic resistance. It is super sturdy and has a small enough footprint to fit on a 2'X4' mat. No hesitations here, we recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Ehrentraut

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn Upright Series old school good
customer_reviews.text: The Schwinn Upright Series is a great at-home exercise bike. The digital graphics are very hard to read - a challenge while riding the bike or setting up your desired program. LARGER digital fonts with heart rate, calories burned, time & RPMs all on one setting would be much better. A pull and push seat height-adjustor would have been nicer than the twist version. Nice price and easy to use, just not see. We're thankful it doesn't have all froufrou touch screen nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Isa & JP Thorson

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet.  Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: You do have to partially put it together, but once that's done, the bike is surprisingly quiet, and comfortable to use. It has a fan, which is great. It's so quiet, we have it in the living room (we have a small apartment) and use of it doesn't disturb watching tv a bit. I really love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cnotediva

customer_reviews.title: Just as described,  uncomfortable seat, but easy fix!
customer_reviews.text: Bike just as described. Took 2 people to assemble. I would have given 5 stars if the bike seat wasn't so uncomfortable. That was remedied by a gel cover.
customer_reviews.author: JulieCski

customer_reviews.title: Great Quarantine Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I got this at the start of our quarantine, knowing I would probably gain 30 pounds if I didn't have something readily available to burn some calories. This bikes great. IT has a relatively small footprint, easy to build, and very easy to operate. I almost bought one of the cheaper bikes on amazon, but i'm very happy I got this one. Great build quality, and I'm hoping i'll be able to use it for a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: This is saving my sanity currently with being at home during quarantine. Setup was very straightforward and took approx 45 min. At times you need an extra hand. It’s quiet and sleek so I can watch TV in my living room and isn’t too much of an eye sore. The upright positioning and seat make this bike very comfortable. The fan is a nice touch I didn’t know I needed. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Zoda

customer_reviews.title: Durable and moveable
customer_reviews.text: The product took about an hour to build. I followed the directions and had no problems. Everything is labeled very clearly. The bike works very well and what was more important to me is that it is easy to move from place to place. You just tilt and move it on it's little wheels. If you are going to buy this I suggest you buy a comfortable foam seat for it because it is a little hard on your rear.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Joe

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Doss the job, but has lots of quality issues as some others said. List so far : - seat is very uncomfy. Had to buy a gel topper. - had scratches - the seat post creaks like crazy, have to keep oiling it. - the center sprocket is also now creaking with each pedal after about 15 uses. Makes for an annoying ride. - some things aren't in alignment, like the console and bars are not aligned with the center of the bike and seat. Besides quality issues, it's actually a decent bike.
customer_reviews.author: MDP

customer_reviews.title: Good exercise machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this bike about a week. So far so good. Fairly easy to assemble, pretty clear directions. Seems to be well made. The digital read outs work well, there are a number of workouts that can be tailored to what I want. I’m 64, I got this bike to improve my cardio. All in all I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pagehs

customer_reviews.title: Nice exercise Bike!
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a nice bike! It took me probably an hour to assemble and parts and instructions were well laid out! Easy to follow! Bike so far has worked great and is smooth to pedal and fits me well. (6') Control panel is good, nothing special but is functional.
customer_reviews.author: billyboy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was extremely easy. I've assembled other products similar to this and found this to be easily completed. The instructions aren't great, but you can figure it out without them. The bike itself has lasted for about six months now without issue. The display does not have a back light; however, a bike for this price rarely has that feature, and (at least for me) that's not a deal breaker. The heart rate sensor also works as expected. Overall I'm enjoying the bike and hope it lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: JTD

customer_reviews.title: Overall I like it
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good product for the price. Was easy to put together and the seat is fairly comfortable. Only gripe is it's not supper sturdy. It's fine just not solid. If you plan to do some hardcore fast peddling I wouldn't recommend this product but for me just doing 20min a day of light peddling it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Extremely quiet -- no sound!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly quiet, this basic bike is just what I needed for working out while watching Netflix. I get a great workout. Every 30-40 miles it seems, I have to tighten the bolts that hold the pedals, or they will make a sound while I am pedaling. That is how quiet this bike is when all screws and bolts are tight. Schwinn says you have to tighten everything periodically anyway. This is a great bike if you eant the basics, and I fully recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Browniebaker

customer_reviews.title: Console stopped working after a year with questionable assembly initially.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, when it was delivered on Oct. 2018, I could not get resistance level above 16. It turns out resistance pad servo getting stuck so fixed myself by applying some oil around the servo. After that it worked fine until recently when console buttons were acting funny. Few days after experiencing, it finally stopped responding to any of button click on the console. Power do come on. Searched for replacement part and could not find one. Emailed to support and waiting for their answer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I love this bike
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this bike, provides a challenge and has so many programs to choose from that you can customize. Our past one was a Schwinn too and I will continue to purchase from this awesome company in the future, very nice quality bikes that last. The prices that they offer them at are also wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Good for home.
customer_reviews.text: Too early to write complete review as I just received it few days ago. But it is easy to assemble, noise level is very good (no noise at all) and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Danny B.

customer_reviews.title: Made me want ride more
customer_reviews.text: Ok so i had the bike for a few weeks now and i can say yes im glad i made the purchase. Easy to set up Its very quiet Love the fan The auxilary / usb input is awesome feels like I'm at the gym. I wish the display was backlit but i can deal with that too many pros otherwise . And its not a big heavy piece of equipment moves easily
customer_reviews.author: Jmj 155

customer_reviews.title: I had problens with the  Schwinn company changing what thry first promised
customer_reviews.text: The servo motor seems to be the problem, as I couldn't lower the resistance level. They were going to send a new motor, only have canceled my order, for what reason I don't know. Then they decided to send the part after I had decided to return the bike. A bad mix up at Schwinn headquarters.
customer_reviews.author: Warren W Cecil Jr

customer_reviews.title: Very good bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: MP3 play plugs in and listen to music through speaker, has a built in fan, various programs, and can set by distance or time. Can see last ride, or combined milage and time for last 7 rides. It would be better to see them individually, but for the price, it is okay. Great buy for entry bike riding (something to do in the winter).
customer_reviews.author: William J. Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: Arrived undamaged. Got bike assembled pretty quickly without any hiccups. Super quiet and durable. Easy to transport once assembled. No issues with tensions. Machine faces the tv so getting my daily dose of exercise is a cinch and very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: H. Tran

customer_reviews.title: So far so good- Schwinn 130 Upright Bike
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this bike for over a month. So far it seems to work fine. Even though the gyms are open, with the current situation of Covid-19, I rather exercise at home or walk in my neighborhood (but it rains a lot in Miami in summer time), so it is very convenient to own a stationary bike.
customer_reviews.author: Javier C.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality !
customer_reviews.text: I also own another piece of Schwinn exercise equipment that I love so figure I couldn't go wrong with this bike. We have all used it, age range 8 years old and up and believe it is of very good quality. The seat is a little uncomfortable but easy to set up and great workout programs on it !
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Seat is initially uncomfortable, but my body quickly adjusted to it. Very quiet and easy to use. Assembly was very straight forward but definitely requires 2 people for one major step (attaching the front post to the unit.) Once that is done, one person can complete the assembly by themselves. I use the bike 30-40 minutes each day and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryster

customer_reviews.title: So happy to have a source of cardio from home
customer_reviews.text: Use my new bike daily. So happy to have a source of cardio from home, especially when its nasty outside! Already put in ~300 miles and still in love. Did need to buy a cushioned seat for comfort (I use at least 4x a week). Already 6 pounds down!
customer_reviews.author: tk

customer_reviews.title: The seat swivels as I pedal !
customer_reviews.text: The seat moves every time I use it ! I don’t know if the part is defective but I have tightened the bolts on the underside of the seat as tight as possible but the seat still swivels as I pedal . I’ve been on hold with the manufacturer for a half hour now and have not reached a person. I am 5’8 and 130lbs, my thighs should not be constantly moving the seat as I pedal!
customer_reviews.author: Allie a

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Operates Smoothly  & Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: The Schwinn 130 is well worth the price, and also worth the assembly costs to have it done. It operates smoothly and have zero issues with the pedals being too close to the base, as I read in other reviews. I wear a size 10 sneaker and it's not even close to rubbing on the base. Perhaps the others didn't have it assembled properly? Anyway I especially like the built-in speaker and aux cord to plug into my phone to listen to Music. It also has a fan and has various workout functions. It does everything I was looking for and seems to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Gina2345

customer_reviews.title: Seat positions limited
customer_reviews.text: heavy bike package delivered in good condition. Not hard to assemble after reading reviews and advice. Problem with seat and stem. no matter how often it is tightened, the seat will end up swiveling to one side. Perhaps adding option of front-back adjustment would address this problem, or allowing customers to purchase front-back seat adjustment as a replacement part. Otherwise, bike performs well, intensity levels are quite heavy, good workout overall. Not as sturdy as bikes at health club, but a lot more affordable. Feet can grip carpeting, but not hardwood, tile or lino.
customer_reviews.author: acw

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike because I needed something to help me get back into exercising. It has a lot of levels and several programs. It allows you to build up to the higher levels by starting with a program that is called "Ride in the park". But don't think this means it's easy. It's a challenge, but not so much that I am giving up. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bike!
customer_reviews.text: I was researching a lot of upright exercise bikes a lot were way more pricier than this one but this one has good reviews so I decided to get this one and I couldn't be happier! it has so many of the features of those fancy $2,000 bikes for so much less $$
customer_reviews.author: JessNIN

customer_reviews.title: My goto for non-gym days
customer_reviews.text: I use this bike on days when I can't make it to the gym. For me it's basically perfect. The seat is soft. Assembly was straight-forward and the instructions were very clear. I like the ledge on the display as my Apple laptop fits perfectly on top of it. I only ride with a fixed resistance, and I have not tried the speakers yet.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My husband assembled the bike so I can't say much about that but I didn't hear him screaming in frustration when he was putting it together. It works well and is pretty quiet. Good value in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie R.

customer_reviews.title: Makes Cardio a breeze
customer_reviews.text: My old Schwinn bike had an accident when we were moving, and the resistance was no longer functional. Very relieved to be able to get a good work out at home again. Looks nice enough I don't mind having it in the corner of my living room. I like that it has the built in programs that let me vary my workout, and that it tracks multiple user data.
customer_reviews.author: shelby koning

customer_reviews.title: Terrible pedals, strap and crank set.
customer_reviews.text: The main problem is that the bike strap and pedal, and crank set is too close to the machine, and you have to be constantly conscious of not rubbing and bumping the heel of your shoe to the side of the machine. My shoe size is 9 so, I imagine if your wear a bigger size shoe you will have a problem with this. It's a shame because the entire point having an exercise bike is all about smooth peddling and that feature is very poor. I plan to call support to see what can be done about this, otherwise it would be a great bike.
customer_reviews.author: eve melendez

customer_reviews.title: Nice upright bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: It was fairly easy to assemble. The only tricky part was attaching the tension cable. The assembly instructions were well written. They had all the small parts on a card, which eliminated any guessing on which screws, washers, nuts, etc. were needed. It took about an hour to assemble. The bike was quieter than I thought. The electronics were not that great, but I wasn't expecting too much.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Levene

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I like the bike overall. Assembly was simple. I did order the wider seat for it. It just meant more comfort for long workouts. Great readouts on the bike for Intensity, Time, Distance and Calories. The one down side is, I cannot get the bike to sync with the Schwinn App on my phone. My Fitbit does do the heart rate really well.
customer_reviews.author: DSand

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was quick, parts fit and the bike performs great. Easy to program. I feel this product is well worth the price paid. I use it every day and have not experienced any problems nor issues. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: G Eric

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: With all the high tech (high price) bikes out there, I was feeling a bit left out. I just needed to be able to pick a setting and go. I don't need a screen yelling at me or a monthly subscription. This was easy to put together, relatively light weight and doesn't take up too much space. Perfect for the price and my needs
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bicycle that was described as being in very good condition, but that the packaging had been damaged. Upon this advice, I ordered the bike. I immediately took it to a dealer, who assembled it for me for $70.00. It would not turn on, and the base was cracked. The dealer had to take it apart, and it cost me $25.00. This fraud cost me $95.00!
customer_reviews.author: Sylmil

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Great bike but screws loosen over time quite often which causes control bar to move regularly. Plastic cover a bit thin, ours cracked, thicker material should be used. But functionality great, still a great purchase and would recommend. Deserves 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RicksOpinion

customer_reviews.title: Such a great home bike!!
customer_reviews.text: It needs to be secured to the ground, in my opinion, but it works like a dream and it's a FANTASTIC value for the money. You can set it to track your workouts to your specific needs so it keeps track of your previous workouts, which is awesome for someone who lives for progress. And the built in fan is a HUGE bonus when you feel like you're dying!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Buy A Seat Cover
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised and seems durable enough for my boyfriend and I. My one complaint is that the seat is as hard as a rock... for the money that this thing costs I would hope they could afford a little extra foam.
customer_reviews.author: Kori

customer_reviews.title: Excellent exercise bike!
customer_reviews.text: No issues and the bike is almost silent. It is built well and was not difficult to assemble. I definitely recommend it if you are looking to purchase a good upright bike. I am a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Bertley

customer_reviews.title: GREAT quality - surprised me!
customer_reviews.text: The setup was relatively straightforward, and the operation is SILENT. Adjustments are easy, everything works great - this was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: B. Shulman

customer_reviews.title: ... schwinn bike 10 year old and it was very good bike but recently it is started clicking noise
customer_reviews.text: I had a schwinn bike 10 year old and it was very good bike but recently it is started clicking noise. I bought schwin 130 new and it keep making clicking noise too beside the heart rate function does not work. I return it back
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Elghandour

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This bike is great and exactly what I was looking for. Its compact and fits in my office. It also has wheels on it so its easy to move. Some great features are: it has a built in fan, had a tablet holder and is easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Rexis

customer_reviews.title: They sent a used one
customer_reviews.text: The bike arrived with scuff marks and worn spots all over the place like its been used. Other than that it works as expected. Some parts were clearly new, like the seat and computer unit. But the main frame has markings all over the plastic. Very disappointing and feels like I wasted my money. I would return it on principle if it wasnt so heavy. I paid for a new bike, not this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Blobaum

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike. At my gym, I use a Precor bike that is a north of two grand to buy. This bike has a similar feel for a fraction of the price. Granted there is a difference in the feel and sturdiness, but for the price, I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly! Easy to assemble. Doesn't take up a lot of room. As comfortable as an upright bike can be. We were checking out the upgraded model at a sporting goods store for over $100 more. Happy we went with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Dumont

customer_reviews.title: Seat uncomfy
customer_reviews.text: Great bike! 49 yr old women. Overweight and this helps me incredibly. Has everything I was looking for. Only complaint I have is the seat becomes uncomfortable after first 15 minutes of riding. I had to purchase a gel seat cushion which works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delivered with defective left pedal
customer_reviews.text: So far I received it yesterday, was able to assemble together by myself, but the left pedal could not be threaded and tightened onto the bar. So I contacted customer service via email since they are closed today and I'm hoping they send a new left pedal so I can actually use this bike ASAP. Looks very promising. Will update review once this is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L

customer_reviews.title: Too basic
customer_reviews.text: Basic bike. You can’t stand up & pedal, you can’t pedal backwards. The fan just makes noise, doesn’t blow much at all. The programmed workouts aren’t easy to navigate. Just very disappointed in this bike. Should have been $100 for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. Bought a new oversized seat that is so much better. I weight 115 lbs and need padded shorts and gel seat in order to bike 10 miles every day. This bike is quiet, sturdy, includes a fan, and is a quality exercise bike. You will love it! Schwinn makes excellent products!
customer_reviews.author: Nan O.

customer_reviews.title: Monitor broke after third use.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened but the display is extremely messed up now. Only used a few times and then this happened. Not sure why. I didn't pay over $300 to have something that just pedals. I'd opt into a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: caleb

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike... Great value
customer_reviews.text: This bike, for the price, is great! The only complaint I have is that my heels want to hit the pedal shaft. I have size 13 feet, perhaps the problem. My wife and teenage children do not have this problem. We really like the input for devices, such as cell phones and MP3 players. Speakers and fan work well. The operation of the unit is very quiet. Nice! The bike arrived in great shape and was pretty east to install, with the help of my son. So far... so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: So one star off for the handlebars being a bit low and the seat hard. Otherwise works great. smooth and consistent. the top screen is mostly useless, the fan is low powered but the bike works great. I would buy again. Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy for non-gear-heads to assemble, sturdy and attractive. Can’t beat it for the price. Will be using to rehab post knee replacement surgery and to warm up for bike rides IRL.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Its what I was looking for except for the programming feature. The console isn't lighted so its difficult to see the different phases of the workout as you are using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Quiet bike. Rides nice.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Nice and quiet for now. Only had it together for a few day and happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: mary e.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having total knee replacement. Using this bike has made all the difference in the world as far as range of motion goes. Highly recommend. My husband and father assembled. From what I heard, directions left little to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Livelifeas1

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived with severed wire connections, rendering the bike defective; they were clean cut as if done by scissors or box cutter. Repacking it was a PITA. Thank goodness Amazon has an easy return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio G.

customer_reviews.title: Love it...but get a seat pad!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this bike. It arrived with everything in perfect condition and only took an hour to assemble by myself. It's a quiet, smooth ride, but I do recommend getting a pad for the seat if you plan to be on it longer than 30 minutes at a time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this
customer_reviews.text: My wife has bad knees and wanted a bike like this. This is everything she wanted and more
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bike
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and was easy to assemble and adjust to fit my height (6'4"). Well built and easy to use. I did not see a guide included on how to use the display though. But it looks pretty straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Brothers

customer_reviews.title: Good bike
customer_reviews.text: It's a good exercise bike. Great for the price. Took about an hour to assemble. It has a charging port and a speaker which are nice features. Other than that don't expect built in programs. But you can easily put on a YouTube spin class video on go along with it like my wife does.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike take the leap
customer_reviews.text: The bike is fairly easy to assemble and it feels well made. Shipping was fast also. The seat isn’t as uncomfortable as I thought it would be based on other reviews. Also my box came in tact and looked brand new to me. ( I saw other reviews where people said there box was damaged or bike looked used so I was hesitant to buy). Glad everything worked out for me.
customer_reviews.author: MaxsMom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Works nicely. I don’t have issue with the seat. Wish it was a bit easier to move around, but it does have back wheels to move it. Doesn’t take up too much space
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Smooth quiet ride.  Good looking.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Sturdy. Doesn’t look or feel cheap. Smooth quiet ride. Comfortable seat. Giving 4 stars only because the holes on the control pad did not line up to the bike so we could only put three screws in rather than four. But it is still very stable. Also the control pad is very dim. But other than that I love it. Easy assembly but two people are needed for one step to connect the main frame to the front pole. It looks great in my office and takes up very little room.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn W.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for large people
customer_reviews.text: Works great and handles my enormous 6'6" frame. The speakers and fan are gimmicks but I don't mind enough to take away a star.
customer_reviews.author: M. Price

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid and rides nicely. Not a gym quality bike, but can't imagine you will find better for $250. Very easy to assemble. Lightweight and easy to move around. Seat is the only major negative. You will likely want to get a gel cover. If you have a small space and limited budget, this bike is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, very comfortable, but most of all it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Chazwani Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Overall this bike is nice. Two cons we have found so far
customer_reviews.text: Overall this bike is nice. Two cons we have found so far: 1) the seat is brutal on the tooshie. 2) the program that is supposed to allow you to sync this to other programs is now outdated and not compatible with the schwinn technology for the new apps. So... Overall good solid built bike with built in programs, but lacking in newest technology and needs a little more cushion in the seat.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie donaghe

customer_reviews.title: it is a bike, its stationary. Does its job
customer_reviews.text: It works well. A little bulky and hard to move on carpets. Electronics are kind of weird to use, too many settings. Fan doesn't do much, and mp3 speakers are kinda a waste (who doesn't use headphones?) But at the end of the day it is a bike, its stationary. Does its job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, great bike
customer_reviews.text: We've had it since the start of the year, it gets used most weeks. It's a great stationary bike and we range from 5'4 to 6'0 and 6'6. The seat has held up, the paint on the post is worn from numerous adjustments. Great bike, yo.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bjerke

customer_reviews.title: Other than that everything seems to work great thus far
customer_reviews.text: There is a fairly significant clunk sound on the up stroke of the right pedal. Other than that everything seems to work great thus far.
customer_reviews.author: kajuroe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and operate, cord needs to be longer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help my husband and I get back into shape, works really well, had no problems putting it together, I only wish the cord that operates it was a little bit longer, i have to maneuver the bike in order to get it at the right angle to my outlet without me tripping over the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. I use it and it has a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Tallone

product_meta.title: Schwinn Upright Bike Series
product_meta.description: The Schwinn Fitness Active Series offers our most streamlined design yet. Designed for a fluid, comfortable ride, it moves you quickly towards your goals with our workout programs. Intuitive and ergonomic, it’s loaded with user-friendly features for a cardio workout that’s effective, comfortable and enjoyable.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes one Schwinn Upright Series Bike – 130 model

Exercise bike dimensions: 41.3” L x 21.4” W x 55.6” H. | Product weight: 58.4 pounds | Weight capacity: 300 pounds | User height range: 4’6” to 6’6” | Flywheel weight: 10 pounds | Plugs to any standard electrical outlet on an 110V-120V circuit.
A high resolution, backlit DualTrack LCD screen with 29 exercise programs so you can track your progress and an adjustable 3-speed fan to keep you cool

Easily adjust the contoured seat with forearms rests and includes ergonomic handlebars feature integrated heart rate grip sensors. Includes an oversized water bottle holder, 3 piece cranks, and transport wheels

Keep track of time, distance, and calorie goals on the machine and with SchwinnConnect or MyFitnessPal with the USB input and the MP3 input allowing for music through the built-in speakers with a USB charging port for your electronic devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
